entry.description: "TRANCHE KEY: 4rCLZMX5zYWApQjYpivFhKVrxCjTJji6V/CCyxjZYqqs1d6AMwIAR0bq1utGVuQEoj9+B8C64rQbHBNjCHWhkT464A4AAAAAAAACSw== Original data file: 3f_Vaccinia_III.mgf. From Tranche: {{i}}Physiological responses to molecular entities such as peptides, proteins, pharmaceutical drugs or whole pathogens are generally mediated through their interactions with specific cell surface protein receptors. Here, we describe the application of specifically designed chemoproteomic reagents in the ligand-based tagging of glycoprotein receptors on living cells. Subsequently, this enables the unbiased and sensitive identification of N-glycoprotein receptors by quantitative mass spectrometry. Applications of this ligand-based receptor capturing (LRC) technology with ligands ranging from peptides to the therapeutic antibody trastuzumab reliably identified the corresponding targets and could localize the approximate ligand binding sites. Using intact vaccinia viruses as ligands, we identified the cell surface proteins AXL, M6PR, DAG1, CSPG4, and CDH13 as binding factors for these complex viruses on human cells. In summary, the LRC technology supports the identification of receptors and receptor panels for (orphan) ligands of almost every description under near-physiological conditions and without the need for genetic manipulations.{{/i}}"
